content.text: WLOP's ability to create ethereal, dreamlike atmospheres while maintaining incredible detail has been a major inspiration. Their use of light and texture creates paintings that feel both realistic and magical.
What I admire most is how WLOP combines traditional painting techniques with digital tools, creating works that feel timeless yet contemporary.

article.title: The Ethereal and Electric Hues of Quinni Art

content.text: Quinni Art's signature style—marked by **vibrant, high-saturation color palettes** and a **soft, ethereal glow**—has been a major source of inspiration for my use of light and color in digital portraits. Her ability to make every piece feel like a dreamy, neon-drenched moment is truly captivating.

Ilya Kuvshinov's masterful blend of Eastern and Western aesthetics, combined with his cinematic lighting and deeply expressive character work, has been a significant inspiration for my own illustrations and approach to visual storytelling.

article.title: Guweiz’s Ethereal Worlds and Story-Driven Characters

content.text: Guweiz (Gu Zheng Wei) is a Singapore-based digital artist celebrated for moody, cinematic illustrations that blend anime influences with urban and fantasy elements. His work often features lone characters bathed in dramatic lighting and textured atmospheres, creating emotional, narrative-rich images.

content.caption: Cover of 'The World of Guweiz: The Art of Gu Zheng Wei' — the artist's official artbook and a good single-source overview of his work.

content.text: Many of Guweiz’s pieces explore themes of solitude, resilience, and fragile beauty. He uses rain, fog, dusk/dawn lighting and subtle color palettes to add emotional weight, and his compositions frequently suggest larger unseen stories just outside the frame.

To see his full portfolio, process posts, and project breakdowns (including many of the individual piece titles and series names), Guweiz’s ArtStation and publisher pages are the most reliable references.
